meanings.definition: The quality of being easily irritated or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: Her pettishness showed when she pouted over small things.
meanings.sent2: His constant pettishness made it hard to have a peaceful conversation with him.
meanings.sent3: Despite her pettishness, we all found her endearing in her own way.
meanings.sent4: The pettishness of the cat was evident as it swatted at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent5: The child's pettishness was like a dark cloud hanging over the family gathering.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was taken aback by the student's pettishness during class.
meanings.sent2: His pettishness often led to unnecessary arguments with his friends.
meanings.sent3: Despite his pettishness, he always managed to make us laugh with his antics.
meanings.sent4: The pettishness in her tone made it clear she was in a bad mood.
meanings.sent5: His pettishness was like a storm brewing on the horizon, ready to unleash its fury.
